schemes.scheme_name: Primary Cooperative Agriculture and Rural Development Bank: For Minor Irrigation
schemes.ministry: Government of Tamil Nadu
schemes.department: Co-operation, Food and Consumer Protection Department
objectives: Provide financial assistance for minor irrigation projects
Enhance water availability and crop productivity
eligibility_criteria: Farmer needing support for minor irrigation

steps: Collect and fill application form from Primary Cooperative Agriculture and Rural Development Bank
Submit to Secretary or Special Officer of the Bank

documents_required: Proof of land ownership or lease

schemes.scheme_name: Primary Cooperative Agriculture and Rural Development Bank: For Plantation (Tea)
schemes.ministry: Government of Tamil Nadu
schemes.department: Co-operation, Food and Consumer Protection Department
objectives: Provide financial assistance for tea plantations
Promote sustainable tea farming
eligibility_criteria: Willing to use loan specifically for tea plantation

steps: Collect and fill application form from Primary Cooperative Agriculture and Rural Development Bank
Submit to Secretary or Special Officer of the Bank

documents_required: Proof of land ownership or lease

schemes.ministry: Government of Tamil Nadu
schemes.department: Agriculture-Farmers Welfare Department
objectives: Provide soil test results and recommendations for balanced fertilizer use
Promote sustainable farming

benefits.soil_health_card: Issued after ₹5 fee per test for macro/micro nutrients

eligibility_criteria: Farmer who submitted soil samples and paid the fee

steps: Fill and submit form with documents to concerned authority

documents_required: Proof of soil sample submission and payment

schemes.scheme_name: Distribution of Certified Seeds of Maize
schemes.ministry: Government of Tamil Nadu
schemes.department: Agriculture-Farmers Welfare Department
objectives: Promote maize cultivation by subsidizing seed cost
Support small, marginal, SC/ST, and women farmers
eligibility_criteria: Farmer growing maize in specified districts
24% benefit flow to SC/ST, 20% to women/women groups

steps: Submit to Assistant Agricultural Officer / Agricultural Officer / Joint Director

documents_required: Proof of land ownership or tenancy

schemes.scheme_name: Pipes Carrying Water From Source To Field
schemes.ministry: Government of Tamil Nadu
schemes.department: Agriculture-Farmers Welfare Department
objectives: Support farmers in improving irrigation facilities
Subsidize the cost of pipes used for water transportation to fields

benefits.subsidy: 50% of the pipe cost or ₹15,000 (whichever is lower) for up to 800 meters
benefits.pipe_types: All types (PVC, HDPE, etc.) and sizes as per farmer requirement

steps: Collect the application form from the nearest Agricultural Office
Fill out the application form and attach required documents
Submit to the Assistant Agricultural Officer (village), Agricultural Officer/Deputy AO (block), or Joint Director of Agriculture (district)

documents_required: Proof of identity (Aadhaar card, Voter ID)
Land ownership documents or lease agreement
Women farmer group registration documents (if applicable)

schemes.scheme_name: Primary Cooperative Agriculture and Rural Development Bank: For Tractor Purchase
schemes.ministry: Government of Tamil Nadu
schemes.department: Co-operation, Food and Consumer Protection Department
objectives: Provide financial support for purchasing tractors
Improve agricultural productivity through mechanization

benefits.loan_amount: Up to 90% of the tractor's cost

eligibility_criteria: Intention to use the loan specifically for tractor purchase

steps: Collect the application form from the Primary Cooperative Agriculture and Rural Development Bank
Fill in the application and attach documents
Submit to the Secretary or Special Officer
Request receipt or acknowledgment with application details

documents_required: Proof of land ownership or lease

schemes.scheme_name: Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi Yojana
schemes.ministry: Ministry Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
schemes.department: Department of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
objectives: Provide income support to small and marginal farmers
Enhance financial stability for farming households
eligibility_criteria: Farmer owning up to 2 hectares of cultivable land

steps: Register through PM-KISAN portal or at CSC

schemes.ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
schemes.department: Department of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
objectives: Provide insurance coverage for crop losses
Stabilize farmers' income

benefits.insurance_coverage: Premium as low as 1.5-5% of sum insured
benefits.compensation: For crop loss due to natural calamities

steps: Apply through banks, CSCs, or insurance companies

schemes.ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
schemes.department: Department of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
objectives: Promote soil health through testing and management
Enhance agricultural productivity

steps: Submit soil samples to local agricultural office

schemes.ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
schemes.department: Department of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
objectives: Create a unified national market for agricultural produce
Ensure better price discovery for farmers

benefits.market_access: Online trading platform for agricultural produce

eligibility_criteria: Farmer or trader registered on e-NAM

schemes.ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
schemes.department: Department of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
objectives: Provide timely credit to farmers
Support agricultural and allied activities

benefits.credit_limit: Up to ₹3 lakh at concessional rates

eligibility_criteria: Farmer engaged in agriculture or allied activities

steps: Apply through banks or cooperative societies

schemes.ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
schemes.department: Department of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
objectives: Promote organic farming
Reduce chemical fertilizer dependency

benefits.financial_assistance: ₹50,000 per hectare for 3 years

eligibility_criteria: Farmer or group of farmers practicing organic farming

schemes.ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
schemes.department: Department of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
objectives: Promote micro-irrigation systems
Enhance water use efficiency

benefits.subsidy: Up to 55% for small farmers, 45% for others

schemes.ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
schemes.department: Department of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
objectives: Promote mechanization among small farmers
Reduce labor costs

schemes.scheme_name: National Mission on Oilseeds and Oil Palm
schemes.ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
schemes.department: Department of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
objectives: Increase oilseed and oil palm production
Reduce import dependency
eligibility_criteria: Farmer cultivating oilseeds or oil palm

schemes.ministry: Ministry of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry & Dairying
schemes.department: Department of Animal Husbandry and Dairying
objectives: Promote dairy farming
Support entrepreneurship in dairy sector
eligibility_criteria: Individual or group engaged in dairy farming

schemes.ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
schemes.department: Department of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
objectives: Promote horticulture crops
Enhance farmer income through diversification

schemes.ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
schemes.department: Department of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
objectives: Promote holistic agricultural development
Increase agricultural productivity

steps: Submit project proposal to state agriculture department

schemes.ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
schemes.department: Department of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
objectives: Promote bamboo cultivation
Support rural livelihoods

benefits.subsidy: On bamboo planting and processing units

eligibility_criteria: Farmer or entrepreneur in bamboo sector

schemes.ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
schemes.department: Department of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
objectives: Provide extension services to farmers
Enhance knowledge and skills

schemes.scheme_name: Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchayee Yojana - Watershed Development
schemes.ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
schemes.department: Department of Land Resources
objectives: Promote sustainable watershed management
Enhance soil and water conservation

steps: Apply through state land resources department

schemes.ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
schemes.department: Department of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
objectives: Promote climate-resilient agriculture
Enhance sustainability

schemes.ministry: Ministry of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry & Dairying
schemes.department: Department of Animal Husbandry and Dairying
objectives: Provide insurance for livestock
Protect farmers from livestock loss

steps: Apply through insurance providers or banks

schemes.ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
schemes.department: Department of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
objectives: Promote agri-entrepreneurship
Provide extension services

benefits.funding: Up to ₹20 lakh for individuals, ₹100 lakh for groups

schemes.ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
schemes.department: Department of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
objectives: Promote beekeeping for pollination and income
Support honey production

rural_development_schemes.scheme_name: Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA)
objectives: Provide at least 100 days of wage employment per rural household
Ensure social protection and strengthen local institutions

benefits.wage_employment: 100 days of guaranteed unskilled manual work

eligibility_criteria: Adult member volunteers to do unskilled manual labor

application_process.mode: Offline/Citizen Application through Gram Panchayat or Help Centre
steps: Apply for job card at Gram Panchayat
List of works available in panchayat

objectives: Provide pucca houses to houseless and kutcha-house dwellers
Ensure basic amenities in rural housing
eligibility_criteria: Rural houseless household and Kutcha house dwellers

steps: Construction and fund releases in installments

objectives: Provide all-weather road connectivity to unconnected habitations

benefits.rural_roads: Construction and upgradation of rural roads

eligibility_criteria: Habitations rural with population criterion (>500 plain, >250 hilly/tribal)

steps: Selection of habitations based on census data

rural_development_schemes.scheme_name: Deen Dayal Antyodaya – National Rural Livelihood Mission (DAY-NRLM)
objectives: Create self-managed institutional structures of rural poor
Improve households' livelihood opportunities
eligibility_criteria: Poor rural households identified via SECC or local process
Preference to women, SC/ST, vulnerable groups

steps: Link to banks for credit and enterprise support

rural_development_schemes.scheme_name: Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Grameen Kaushalya Yojana (DDU-GKY)
objectives: Skill rural youth (15–35 years) and place them in jobs
Diversify rural family income and support poor youth
eligibility_criteria: Rural youth aged 15–35 from poor families
Preferably BPL or identified via SECC

application_process.mode: Via training centers empaneled under RDAs
steps: Placed in jobs via placement partners

objectives: Provide financial assistance to vulnerable rural populations

steps: Validate and sanction by state government

rural_development_schemes.scheme_name: Old Age Pension Scheme under Chief Minister’s Uzhavar Padhukappu Thittam
rural_development_schemes.department: Social Welfare and Women Empowerment Department
objectives: Provide monthly pension and welfare support to elderly farmers and agricultural laborers

benefits.free_clothes: Dhoti (men) / Saree (women) during Pongal and Deepavali

eligibility_criteria: Destitute farmer or landless agricultural laborer
documents_required: Any identity proof (Voter ID, PAN, etc.)

rural_development_schemes.scheme_name: Afforestation Schemes Providing Incentives And Employment To Tribals In Forest
rural_development_schemes.parent_scheme: Tribal Forest Employment and Incentive Scheme
rural_development_schemes.department: Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department
objectives: Provide livelihood opportunities to unemployed tribals
Encourage tribal participation in afforestation and forest operations
Promote sustainable forest management

benefits.incentive: Financial grants for participating in afforestation
benefits.employment: Employment opportunities in forest conservation activities

eligibility_criteria: Must belong to a tribal community

steps: Collect application form from the office of the District Forest Officer (DFO)
Fill in the form with required details and attach documents
Submit the form to DFO office
Request receipt or acknowledgment with application ID (if applicable)

documents_required: Proof of identity (Aadhaar card or similar)
Proof of residence in tribal/forest area

rural_development_schemes.scheme_name: District Central Cooperative Banks and through its Branches: For SSI Unit Loan and Other NFS Activities
rural_development_schemes.department: Co-operation, Food and Consumer Protection Department
objectives: Provide financial assistance to promote small-scale industries
Encourage growth of non-farm sector activities
eligibility_criteria: Loan purpose should be for SSI Unit or other Non-Farm Sector activities

steps: Collect application form from District Central Cooperative Banks or branches
Fill and submit the form along with required documents

documents_required: Business Plan or Project Report (if applicable)

objectives: Provide safe drinking water to rural households

steps: Apply through District Central Cooperative Banks

objectives: Develop safe play areas in urban communities
Promote healthy recreation and sports

benefits.infrastructure_support: Funding for developing urban play areas

eligibility_criteria: Urban communities or local bodies in Goa
Projects for safe play area development

steps: Apply through Department of Sports and Youth Affairs

objectives: Provide travel concessions for differently abled persons
Enhance accessibility in state-owned buses

benefits.concession: Discounted or free travel in state transport buses

eligibility_criteria: Person with disability certified by medical authority

steps: Apply through Transport Department or state bus corporations

rural_development_schemes.department: Food, Public Distribution & Consumer Affairs Department
objectives: Provide petrol subsidy for two-wheelers
Support NFSA/Jharkhand State Food Security Scheme beneficiaries
eligibility_criteria: Beneficiary of NFSA or Jharkhand State Food Security Scheme

steps: Apply through Food, Public Distribution & Consumer Affairs Department

rural_development_schemes.scheme_name: Subsidy to Purchase E-Bike for Journalists
objectives: Provide financial assistance for e-bike purchase
Support journalists’ mobility and reduce pollution

steps: Apply through Department of Information and Publicity

rural_development_schemes.scheme_name: Grant of Fuel Subsidy to Differently Abled Persons Who Are Owning Motorised Vehicles
objectives: Provide fuel subsidy for differently abled persons
Support mobility for motorized vehicle owners
eligibility_criteria: Person with disability owning a motorized vehicle

Submit disability certificate and vehicle details

rural_development_schemes.scheme_name: Infrastructure Development Subsidy (For IT/ITES) under Motivation of Entrepreneurs to Start Industries and Fiscal Assistance to Capital Intensive Industries
objectives: Support infrastructure for IT/ITES industries
Provide subsidies for building investments

benefits.subsidy: 30% subsidy on building investment, up to ₹1,00,00,000 for 50,000 sq.ft.

eligibility_criteria: Infrastructure developers or IT/ITES industries in Puducherry

steps: Apply through Industries and Commerce Department

rural_development_schemes.scheme_name: Grant-in-aid Scheme to Village Education Committees/Urban Education Committees for minor repairs of Government School buildings
objectives: Provide grants for minor repairs of government school buildings
Support Village/Urban Education Committees

benefits.grant: Financial assistance for minor school building repairs

objectives: Promote cleaner transportation through e-rickshaws
Generate employment opportunities for entrepreneurs

benefits.financial_assistance: Subsidies and incentives for e-rickshaw purchase

eligibility_criteria: Individuals/entrepreneurs operating e-rickshaws in urban/semi-urban areas

objectives: Encourage savings for girl child’s education and marriage expenses
Promote financial security and empowerment of girls
Foster gender equality through financial inclusion

benefits.interest_rate: 8.2% per annum (compounded annually, for Q1 FY 2025-26)
benefits.tax_benefits: Tax deduction up to ₹1.5 lakh under Section 80C, tax-exempt interest and maturity amount
benefits.investment_limits: Minimum ₹250 per year, maximum ₹1.5 lakh per year
benefits.maturity_period: 21 years from account opening or upon marriage (whichever is earlier)
benefits.partial_withdrawal: Up to 50% of balance after girl turns 18 or passes 10th standard for education

eligibility_criteria: Girl child below 10 years at account opening
Account opened by parents or legal guardian
Maximum two accounts per family (three for twins/triplets)

steps: Visit a participating post office or authorized bank
Complete Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana application form
Submit required documents and initial deposit (minimum ₹250)
Account opened after verification, passbook issued

documents_required: Birth certificate of the girl child
Identity proof of parent/guardian (Aadhaar, PAN, Voter ID, etc.)
Residence proof (driving license, passport, utility bill, etc.)
Photograph of parent/guardian and girl child

rural_development_schemes.ministry: Ministry of Women and Child Development
rural_development_schemes.department: Department of Women and Child Development
objectives: Promote education and health of girl children in poor families
Discourage child marriage and promote gender equality
Provide financial support for socio-economic challenges

benefits.educational_scholarship: Annual scholarships from ₹300 to ₹1,000 for classes 1 to 10

eligibility_criteria: Girl child born on or after August 15, 1997
Belongs to Economically Weaker Section (EWS) or Below Poverty Line (BPL) families
Family income not exceeding ₹2 lakh annually
Not receiving pension or other government financial support
Limited to two girls per family

steps: Apply through local Anganwadi centers or district authorities
Submit application form with required documents
Funds credited to beneficiary’s bank account

documents_required: Birth certificate of the girl child
Identity proof of parent/guardian (PAN, Voter ID, etc.)
Residence proof (ration card, utility bill, etc.)

objectives: Increase enrollment of girls in prestigious engineering institutions
Provide coaching and financial support for entrance exams
Promote gender equality in technical education

benefits.coaching: Free online/offline coaching for engineering entrance exams
benefits.financial_support: Scholarships and study material for selected students
benefits.mentorship: Access to tutorials, lectures, and peer-to-peer learning

eligibility_criteria: Enrolled in CBSE-affiliated schools with PCM (Physics, Chemistry, Maths)
Minimum 70% marks in Class 10 and 80% in Science and Maths

steps: Selection based on merit and verification

rural_development_schemes.scheme_name: National Scheme of Incentive to Girls for Secondary Education (NSIGSE)
rural_development_schemes.department: Department of School Education and Literacy
objectives: Promote secondary education among girl students
Reduce dropout rates in secondary schools
Encourage girls from disadvantaged communities to continue education

benefits.incentive: ₹3,000 fixed deposit upon passing Class 8, withdrawable after Class 10

eligibility_criteria: Girl students belonging to SC/ST or those who passed Class 8 from Kasturba Gandhi Balika Vidyalayas
Enrolled in Class 9 in government, government-aided, or local body schools
Below 16 years at the time of admission to Class 9

steps: Verification by school and state education department
Incentive deposited in girl’s bank account

objectives: Promote birth of girl children and gender equality
Provide financial support for girls’ future needs
Encourage savings for education and marriage

benefits.investment: ₹2,000 invested in girl’s name at birth

eligibility_criteria: Girl child born on or after November 22, 2007
Limited to two girls per family

steps: Apply through local Anganwadi centers or district social welfare office

documents_required: Birth certificate of the girl child

objectives: Promote education and empowerment of girl children
Provide financial assistance from birth to graduation
Prevent child marriage and support health and education

benefits.financial_assistance: ₹54,100 total (₹2,000 at birth, ₹1,000 for vaccinations, ₹2,000 for school enrollment, ₹10,000 for Class 10, ₹25,000 for Class 12, ₹14,100 for graduation)

eligibility_criteria: Girl child born to Bihar residents
No income limit, applicable to all girls
Enrolled in school/college for respective benefits

steps: Apply through Bihar government portal or Anganwadi centers
Submit documents for each stage (birth, school, college)

rural_development_schemes.department: Department of Social Justice and Empowerment
objectives: Promote family planning and welfare of girl children
Provide financial incentives for families with one or two girls
Encourage education and health of girls

benefits.financial_incentive: ₹25,000 for one girl child, ₹20,000 per girl for two girls

eligibility_criteria: Families with one or two girl children
Parents not receiving government pension or financial support

steps: Apply through district social welfare office

rural_development_schemes.department: Department of Women and Child Development
objectives: Improve child sex ratio and promote girl child welfare
Provide financial support for education and marriage
Encourage positive attitude towards girl children

benefits.financial_assistance: ₹5,000 per year for 5 years, ₹1 lakh at age 18

eligibility_criteria: Girl child born on or after April 1, 2015
Limited to two girls per family
documents_required: Birth certificate of the girl child

rural_development_schemes.ministry: Ministry of Women and Child Development
rural_development_schemes.department: Department of Women and Child Development
objectives: Promote survival and education of girl children
Provide conditional cash transfers for health and education milestones
Reduce gender discrimination and child marriage

benefits.cash_transfers: ₹5,000 at birth, additional amounts for vaccination, school enrollment, and retention up to Class 8 (total up to ₹1 lakh)

eligibility_criteria: Meeting health and education milestones (e.g., vaccination, school attendance)

steps: Apply through local Anganwadi centers or district authorities
Cash transfers credited to beneficiary’s account

rural_development_schemes.ministry: Ministry of Women and Child Development
rural_development_schemes.department: Department of Women and Child Development
objectives: Prevent gender-biased sex selection
Ensure survival, protection, and education of girl children
Promote gender equality and social empowerment

benefits.multi_sectoral_interventions: Coordination with health and education sectors for girl child welfare
benefits.financial_incentives: Support for education in select districts

eligibility_criteria: Residents of India, with focus on low Child Sex Ratio districts
No specific income criteria for awareness benefits

steps: Access benefits through local Anganwadi centers or schools
Register for specific incentives via district authorities
No formal application for awareness campaigns

rural_development_schemes.scheme_name: Chief Minister’s Girl Child Protection Scheme
rural_development_schemes.department: Social Welfare and Women Empowerment Department
objectives: Prevent gender discrimination by empowering girl children
Promote enrollment and retention of girls in school up to intermediate level
Encourage marriage after age 18 and promote family planning with two girl children
Provide social and financial empowerment to girl children

benefits.financial_assistance_one_girl: ₹50,000 fixed deposit for families with one girl child, maturing at age 18
benefits.financial_assistance_two_girls: ₹25,000 fixed deposit per girl for families with two girl children, maturing at age 18
benefits.additional_incentive: ₹1,800 monthly for 6 years for one girl child completing Class 8

eligibility_criteria: Family income below ₹72,000 annually (for one girl scheme) or ₹50,000 (for two girls scheme)
Girl child born on or after August 1, 2001 (one girl) or August 1, 2002 (two girls)
Parents must have undergone sterilization within age 35 for one girl scheme
Limited to one or two girl children per family

steps: Apply through District Social Welfare Office or Block Development Office
Submit application form with required documents
Fixed deposit created with Tamil Nadu Power Finance and Infrastructure Development Corporation Limited

documents_required: Birth certificate of the girl child

rural_development_schemes.scheme_name: Moovalur Ramamirtham Ammaiyar Ninaivu Marriage Assistance Scheme
rural_development_schemes.department: Social Welfare and Women Empowerment Department
objectives: Provide financial assistance for marriage of poor and destitute women
Promote education among women by incentivizing higher studies
Support economically disadvantaged families

benefits.scheme_1: ₹25,000 and 8 grams of gold for non-graduates
benefits.scheme_2: ₹50,000 and 8 grams of gold for graduates or diploma holders

eligibility_criteria: For Scheme 2: Completed degree/diploma from recognized institution

steps: Apply through e-Sevai centres or District Social Welfare Office
Assistance disbursed via bank transfer and gold provided

benefits.scheme_2: ₹50,000 and 8 grams of gold for graduates or diploma holders

Provide financial assistance for starting micro/small enterprises
Enhance economic independence for marginalized women

benefits.corpus_fund: ₹500 lakh corpus fund at district level

Submit incident details and supporting documents

objectives: Provide financial assistance to women in Self-Help Groups (SHGs)
Promote economic empowerment through debt redemption
Enhance financial inclusion and livelihood opportunities

benefits.financial_assistance: Loan waiver and direct financial support up to ₹25,000 per SHG member

Outstanding loans with banks as of specified cutoff date

Financial assistance disbursed via Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT)

objectives: Provide financial support to women for economic empowerment
Promote entrepreneurship and livelihood opportunities

benefits.financial_assistance: ₹75,000 over four years (₹18,750 annually) for women
benefits.market_linkages: Support for starting businesses with private sector tie-ups
